column1: Nizhnyaya Salda (Russian: Ни́жняя Салда́) is a town in Sverdlovsk Oblast
column3: located on the Salda River (Ob's basin)
column5: the administrative center of the oblast. Population: 17

column1: It was founded in 1760; town status was granted to it in 1938.
Within the framework of the administrative divisions
column4: incorporated as the Town of Nizhnyaya Salda—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column5: the Town of Nizhnyaya Salda is incorporated as Nizhnyaya Salda Urban Okrug.
